duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide engineering technical assistance to the Ride/Show teams in support of scenic scopes of work.
Review vendor-provided design review documents, including drawing review, component selection review, calculation review, test plan review, and test results review.
Edit and update Ride/Show engineering specifications as assigned by Ride/Show engineering management in support of special effects system delivery.
Assist Ride/Show team in managing vendors through the process of bidding, designing, manufacturing, testing, shipping, installation, start-up, and commissioning of special effects systems.
Review, edit, or develop test protocols, procedures, and plans. Execute witness or approve testing and test results as assigned and authorized by Engineering & Safety management.
Understand and participate in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training, and team member involvement activities.
Project experience within the entertainment/theme park industry.
Interpret technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with abstract and concrete variables.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in applicable technical field required (examples include, but are not limited to, Technical Theater, Animation, Visual Effects, Mechanical Engineering) or equivalent demonstrated skill and experience; Advanced Degree preferred.
